content.body:
I seem to recall hearing about reducing the number of new globally scoped objects, instead requiring they be explicitly imported as a module.
Though now I can't figure out any source for this.

Is this/will this be a thing?

https://github.com/tc39/proposal-built-in-modules tc39/proposal-built-in-modules
Afaik conversation hasn't happened much in last 5 years
content.formatted_body:
https://github.com/tc39/proposal-built-in-modules tc39/proposal-built-in-modules
Afaik conversation hasn't happened much in last 5 years

content.body: All current active proposals that add new names are being proposed to add either to an existing namespace/prototype. Or, in some cases, a new global name
content.formatted_body: All current active proposals that add new names are being proposed to add either to an existing namespace/prototype. Or, in some cases, a new global name

content.body: I'm interested given the possibility of collisions with existing libraries. An import would do well to solve the problem, but if the proposal is inactive then it might not be the solution I'd hoped.
This is regarding the Random Functions proposal, where I expect a global 'Random' might be too common to avoid collisions. Though I've not looked into it too deeply; this was just on my mind.
If there turns out to be web compat issues a different name will be chosen
content.formatted_body: If there turns out to be web compat issues a different name will be chosen

content.body: Introducing built in modules would be a fairely large change to the language, so any proposal that wants to try and be the first suddenly becomes a much larger proposal
content.formatted_body: Introducing built in modules would be a fairely large change to the language, so any proposal that wants to try and be the first suddenly becomes a much larger proposal

content.body:
Fair enough. Just looking into it on a surface level I found:
https://www.npmjs.com/package/random-js

Which seems to introduce a `Random` constructor. 336k weekly downloads.
I'll just make a note for myself now. Not really a time to have a discussion in Stage 1 but I like to think forward still.
content.formatted_body:
Fair enough. Just looking into it on a surface level I found:
https://www.npmjs.com/package/random-js

Which seems to introduce a Random constructor. 336k weekly downloads.
I'll just make a note for myself now. Not really a time to have a discussion in Stage 1 but I like to think forward still.

things would only be breaking if there was an app doing something like:

if (typeof Random === "undefined") {
  window.Random = ... // setup custom random lib that is different from the proposal 
}

content.body: an uncommon pattern for more modern apps
Thanks, that's good to know. I appreciate the help.
